summary: This FBI electronic communication requests the opening of an investigation into the transfer of $15,000,000 from Jeffrey Epstein's Deutsche Bank account to his defunct Southern Country International bank in the US Virgin Islands the day after his death. The document details the history of the bank, its officers, and Epstein's related Virgin Islands companies, and cites potential violations of 18 USC 1032 (concealment of assets). The investigation will be joint between the FBI and IRS-CID.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of investigation, officer of Southern Country International
persons.context: The deceased financier whose $15 million post-death transfer is under investigation. He was an officer of the bank Southern Country International and used its address for other Virgin Islands companies.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.role: Executor of Epstein's will, officer of Southern Country International
persons.context: Listed as an officer of Financial Strategy Group/Southern Country International and named as an executor in Epstein's will, rewritten while he was in custody.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.role: Executor of Epstein's will, officer of Southern Country International
persons.context: Listed as an officer of Financial Strategy Group/Southern Country International and named as an executor in Epstein's will, rewritten while he was in custody.

persons.name: Boris Nikolic
persons.context: Named as an executor in Jeffrey Epstein's will, which was rewritten while he was in custody pending trial.

persons.name: Erika Kellerhals
persons.context: Submitted the banking business license application for Financial Strategy Group, Ltd. in the US Virgin Islands on March 21, 2013.

connections.description: Both were listed as officers of Financial Strategy Group/Southern Country International. Indyke was also named an executor of Epstein's will.
Both were listed as officers of Financial Strategy Group/Southern Country International. Kahn was also named an executor of Epstein's will.
Nikolic was named as an executor of Jeffrey Epstein's will.
Both were named as executors of Jeffrey Epstein's will.
Kellerhals, as a local attorney, submitted the banking license application for Epstein's company, Financial Strategy Group, Ltd.

events.title: Banking License Application Filed
events.description: Financial Strategy Group, Ltd. (FSG) submitted an application for a banking business license in the US Virgin Islands through attorney Erika Kellerhals.

events.title: Bank Renamed and Licensed
events.description: Financial Strategy Group, Ltd. was renamed Southern Country International, Ltd. and designated as an International Banking Entity. It received a business license from the Virgin Islands Lieutenant Governor's Office.

events.title: Epstein Arrested in NYC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested in New York City on charges unrelated to the Southern Country International bank.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide in the Bureau of Prisons Metropolitan Corrections Center (MCC) while in custody pending trial.

events.title: $15 Million Bank Transfer
events.description: A transfer of $15 million was moved from a Jeffrey Epstein account at Deutsche Bank in New York to the Southern Country International bank in the US Virgin Islands.

events.title: FBI Case Opening Request
events.description: The FBI drafted an electronic communication to open an investigation (196D-SJ-3262541) into the $15 million transfer for potential violation of 18 USC 1032 (concealment of assets).

locations: Port of Sale Mall, Havensite, US Virgin Islands
St. Thomas, VI 00802 (yachting marina dock space)
Bureau of Prisons Metropolitan Corrections Center (MCC)
keyFacts: A $15,000,000 transfer was made from Jeffrey Epstein's Deutsche Bank account to his Virgin Islands bank, Southern Country International, on August 11, 2019, the day after his death.
Southern Country International was a defunct International Banking Entity with a listed address that was merely a yachting marina dock space with no physical banking premises.
Epstein, Darren Indyke, and Richard Kahn were listed as officers of the bank's predecessor, Financial Strategy Group, Ltd., which had an initial value of $100,000.
While in custody in July 2019, Epstein rewrote his will, naming Darren Indyke, Richard Kahn, and Boris Nikolic as executors.

The FBI and IRS-CID are opening a joint investigation into the transfer for potential violation of 18 U.S.C. ยง 1032, concerning concealment of assets from a conservator, receiver, or liquidating agent.
